Title 1
ADMINISTRATION
Chapter 1
OFFICIAL VILLAGE CODE
1-1-1: TITLE:
Upon the adoption by the corporate authorities, this village code is hereby declared to be and shall hereafter constitute the official village code of
Barrington. This village code of ordinances shall be known and cited as the BARRINGTON VILLAGE CODE and is hereby published by authority of the
corporate authorities and shall be supplemented to incorporate the most recent legislation of the village as provided in section 1-1-3 of this chapter. Any
reference to the number of any section contained herein shall be understood to refer to the position of the same number, its appropriate chapter and title
heading, and to the general penalty clause relating thereto, as well as to the section itself, when reference is made to this village code by title in any legal
documents. (2003 Code)
1-1-2: ACCEPTANCE:
The village code, as hereby presented in printed form, shall hereafter be received without further proof in all courts and in administrative tribunals of this
state as the ordinances of the village of general and permanent effect, except the excluded ordinances enumerated in section 1-2-1 of this title. (2003
Code)
1-1-3: AMENDMENTS:
A. Procedure For Amending Code: Any ordinance amending the village code shall set forth the title, chapter and section number of the section or sections
to be amended, and this shall constitute sufficient compliance with any statutory requirement pertaining to the amendment or revision by ordinance of
any part of this village code. All such amendments or revisions by ordinance shall be immediately forwarded to the codifiers, and the said ordinance
material shall be prepared for insertion in its proper place in each copy of this village code. Each such replacement page shall be properly identified
and shall be inserted in each individual copy of the village code.
B. Incorporation Of Amendments: Any addition or amendment to this code, when passed in such form as to indicate the intention of the corporate
authorities to make the same a part of this code, shall be deemed to be incorporated in this code so that a reference to the municipal code of
Barrington shall be understood to include them.
C. Records Kept: The village clerk shall keep a separate book containing every amendment or addition passed to this code, with a reference on each copy
of such amendment or addition as to the place in the record of ordinances where the original ordinance may be found. These records shall be kept in
addition to the record of ordinances which the clerk is required to keep by statute. (2003 Code)
1-1-4: CODE ALTERATIONS:
It shall be deemed unlawful for any person to alter, change, replace or deface in any way any section or any page of this village code in such a manner
that the meaning of any phrase or order may be changed or omitted. Replacement pages may be inserted according to the official instructions when so
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 27/522
authorized by the corporate authorities. The village clerk shall see that the replacement pages are properly inserted in the official copies maintained in the
office of the clerk. Any person having in his custody an official copy of the village code shall make every effort to maintain said code in an up to date and
efficient manner. He shall see to the immediate insertion of new or replacement pages when such are delivered to him or made available to him through
the office of the village clerk. Said code, while in actual possession of officials and other interested persons, shall be and remain the property of the village
and shall be returned to the office of the village clerk when directed so to do by order of the corporate authorities. (2003 Code)
1-1-5: COPIES OF CODE:
A. Distribution Of Copies: All of the printed copies of this code belonging to the village shall be deposited with the clerk. He shall deliver one copy thereof
to the president and each trustee and copies to such other persons as the clerk deems appropriate.
B. Copies To Other Governmental Bodies: The corporate authorities shall have the power to extend or reciprocate courtesies of other municipalities by
presenting them with a copy of this code, bound at the expense of the village, as to the village seems suitable, and the village shall also have the
power to present two (2) copies of this code to the Illinois municipal league. (2003 Code)
Chapter 2
SAVING CLAUSE
1-2-1: REPEAL OF GENERAL ORDINANCES:
All general ordinances of the village passed prior to the adoption of this village code are hereby repealed, except such as are included in this village code
or are by necessary implication herein reserved from repeal (subject to the saving clauses contained in the following sections), and excluding the following
ordinances which are not hereby repealed: tax levy ordinances; appropriation ordinances; ordinances relating to boundaries and annexations; franchise
ordinances and other ordinances granting special rights to persons or corporations; contract ordinances and ordinances authorizing the execution of a
contract or the issuance of warrants; salary ordinances; ordinances establishing, naming or vacating streets, alleys or other public places; improvement
ordinances; bond ordinances; ordinances relating to elections; ordinances relating to the transfer or acceptance of real estate by or from the village; zoning
ordinances1; subdivision ordinances2; and all special ordinances. (2003 Code)
1-2-2: PUBLIC WAYS AND PUBLIC UTILITY ORDINANCES:
No ordinance relating to railroad crossings with streets and other public ways, or relating to the conduct, duties, service or rates of public utilities shall be
repealed by virtue of the adoption of this village code or by virtue of the preceding section, excepting as the village code may contain provisions for such
matters, in which case, this village code shall be considered as amending such ordinance or ordinances in respect to such provisions only. (2003 Code)
1-2-3: COURT PROCEEDINGS:
A. Repeals Do Not Revive Prior Ordinances: When any ordinance repealing a former ordinance, clause or provision shall be itself repealed, such repeal
shall not be construed to revive such former ordinance, clause or provision unless it shall be therein so expressly provided.
B. Current Pending Actions: The repeal of an ordinance shall not affect any punishment or penalty incurred before the repeal took effect, nor any suit,
prosecution or proceeding pending at the time of the repeal, for an offense committed or cause of action arising under the ordinance repealed. (1973
Code § 1-7)
1-2-4: SEVERABILITY CLAUSE:
The sections, paragraphs, sentences, clauses and phrases of this code are severable, and if any phrase, clause, sentence, paragraph or section of this
code shall be declared unconstitutional, invalid or unenforceable by the valid judgment or decree of a court of competent jurisdiction, such
unconstitutionality, invalidity or unenforceability shall not affect any of the remaining phrases, clauses, sentences, paragraphs and sections of this code.
(1973 Code § 1-8)
Chapter 3
DEFINITIONS
1-3-1: CONSTRUCTION OF WORDS:
A. Whenever any word in any section of this code importing the plural number is used in describing or referring to any matters, parties or persons, any
single matter, party or person shall be deemed to be included, although distributive words may not have been used. When any subject matter, party or
person is referred to in this code by words importing the singular number only, or a particular gender, several matters, parties or persons and the
opposite gender and bodies corporate shall be deemed to be included; provided, that these rules of construction shall not be applied to any section of
this code which contains any express provision excluding such construction or where the subject matter or context may be repugnant thereto. (2003
Code)
B. All general provisions, terms, phrases and expressions contained in this code shall be liberally construed in order that the true intent and meaning of the
board of trustees may be fully carried out.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 28/522
C. In the interpretation and application of any provisions of this code, they shall be held to be the minimum requirements adopted for the promotion of the
public health, safety, comfort, convenience and general welfare. Where any provision of this code imposes greater restrictions upon the subject matter
than the general provision imposed by this code, the provision imposing the greater restriction or regulation shall be deemed to be controlling.
D. Words and phrases shall be construed according to the common and approved usage of the language, but technical words and phrases and such
others as may have acquired a peculiar and appropriate meaning in law shall be construed and understood according to such meaning. (1973 Code
§ 1-2)
E. The word "ordinance" contained in the ordinances of the village has been changed in the content of this code to "title", "chapter", "section" and/or
"subsection" or words of like import for organizational and clarification purposes only. Such change to the village's ordinances is not meant to amend
passage and effective dates of such original ordinances. (2003 Code)
1-3-2: DEFINITIONS, GENERAL:
Whenever the following words or terms are used in this code, they shall have such meanings herein ascribed to them, unless the context makes such
meaning repugnant thereto:
AGENT: A person acting on behalf of another with authority conferred, either expressly or by implication.
BOARD; BOARD OF TRUSTEES; VILLAGE BOARD: Unless otherwise indicated, the board of trustees of the village of Barrington. The board of trustees
shall consist of the president and trustees.
CODE: The village code of the village of Barrington.
COMPUTATION OF TIME: The time within which any act provided by law is to be done shall be computed by excluding the first day and including the last,
unless the last day is Saturday or Sunday or is a holiday as defined or fixed in any statute now or hereafter in force in this state, and then it shall also be
excluded. If the day succeeding such Saturday, Sunday or holiday is also a holiday or a Saturday or Sunday, then such succeeding day shall also be
excluded.
CORPORATE AUTHORITIES: The president and trustees of the village.
CORPORATE OR VILLAGE LIMITS: The term "corporate limits" or "village limits" shall mean the legal boundaries of the village of Barrington.
COUNTIES: The counties of Cook and Lake, state of Illinois.
DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY: Whenever a provision appears requiring the head of a department or some other village officer to do some act or perform
some duty, it is to be construed to authorize the head of the department or other officer to designate, delegate and authorize subordinates to perform the
required act or perform the duty unless the terms of the provision or section specify otherwise.
EMPLOYEES: Whenever reference is made in this code to a village employee by title only, this shall be construed as though followed by the words "of the
village of Barrington".
FISCAL YEAR: The fiscal year for the village shall begin on January 1 of each year and shall end on December 31 of the same calendar year.
GENDER: A word importing either the masculine or feminine gender only shall extend and be applied to the other gender and to persons.
JOINT AUTHORITY: All words giving a joint authority to three (3) or more persons or officers shall be construed as giving such authority to a majority of
such persons or officers unless otherwise provided by ordinance or statute.
LICENSE: The permission granted for the carrying on of a business, profession, occupation, or other activity.
MONTH: A calendar month.
NUISANCE: Anything offensive to the sensibilities of reasonable persons, or any act or activity creating a hazard which threatens the health and welfare of
inhabitants of the village, or any activity which by its perpetuation can reasonably be said to have a detrimental effect on the property of a person or
persons within the community.
OATH: Shall be construed to include an affirmation in all cases in which, by law, an affirmation may be substituted for an oath, and in such cases, the
words "swear" and "sworn" shall be equivalent to the words "affirm" and "affirmed".
OCCUPANT: As applied to a building or land, shall include any person who occupies the whole or any part of such building or land whether alone or with
others.
OFFENSE: Any act forbidden by any provision of this code or the omission of any act required by the provisions of this code.
OFFICERS: Whenever reference is made in this code to a village officer by title only, this shall be construed as though followed by the words "of the village
of Barrington".
OPERATOR: The person who is in charge of any operation, business or profession.
OWNER: As applied to a building or land, shall include any part owner, joint owner, tenant in common, tenant in partnership, joint tenant, tenant by the
entirety, beneficiary of a trust, or lessee of the whole or of a part of such building or land.
PERSON: Any public or private corporation, firm, partnership, association, organization, government or any other group acting as a unit, as well as a
natural person. This term shall include, but shall not be limited to, any for profit, not for profit, or religious corporation, or any homeowners' association.
PERSONAL PROPERTY: Includes every species of property except "real property" as herein described.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 29/522
PROPERTY: Includes real and personal property.
REAL PROPERTY: Includes lands, tenements and hereditaments.
RECORD: A written or electronic account of the proceedings of the village.
RETAILER: Unless otherwise specifically defined, shall be understood to relate to the sale of goods, merchandise, articles or things direct to the consumer.
RIGHT OF WAY: The privilege of the immediate use of the roadway or other property.
SEAL: The corporate seal of the village shall be a circular disc with the words "Village of Barrington, Cook and Lake Counties, Illinois" on the perimeter,
and the word "SEAL" in the center thereof.
SIDEWALK: Any portion of a street between the curb line and the adjacent property line, intended for the use of pedestrians.
STATE: The state of Illinois.
STREET: Embraces streets, avenues, boulevards, roads, alleys, lanes, viaducts and all other public ways in the village, and shall include all areas thereof
embraced between the property lines and dedicated, by common law or otherwise, to the public use.
TENANT: As applied to a building or land, shall include any person who occupies the whole or any part of such building or land, whether alone or with
others.
VILLAGE: The village of Barrington, counties of Cook and Lake, state of Illinois.
VILLAGE CLERK: The duly elected village clerk of the village of Barrington, or the deputy clerk duly appointed by such village clerk when authorized by
law, or such other designee of the village clerk as he may duly authorize to act on his behalf.
WHOLESALER AND WHOLESALE DEALER: Unless otherwise specifically defined, shall be understood to relate to the sale of goods, merchandise,
articles or things to persons who purchase for the purpose of resale.
WRITTEN, IN WRITING: May include printing and any other mode of representing words and letters, but when the written signature of any person is
required by law to any official or public writing or bond, it shall be in the proper handwriting of such person or, in case such person is unable to write, by
such person's proper mark. (Ord. 08-3448, 6-9-2008; amd. Ord. 09-3515, 5-26-2009)
1-3-3: CATCHLINES:
The catchlines of the several sections of this code are intended as mere catchwords to indicate the contents of the section and shall not be deemed or
taken to be titles of such section, nor as any part of the section, nor, unless expressly so provided, shall they be so deemed when any of such sections,
including the catchlines, are amended or reenacted. (1973 Code § 1-3; amd. 2003 Code)
Chapter 4
GENERAL PENALTY
1-4-1: GENERAL PENALTY1:
A. Whenever in this code or in any ordinance of the village any act is prohibited or is made or declared to be unlawful, or whenever in such code or
ordinance the doing of any act is required or the failure to do any act is declared to be unlawful, where no specific penalty, and/or no specific minimum
penalty, is provided therefor, the violation of any such provision of this code or any ordinance shall be punishable by a fine of not less than one hundred
dollars ($100.00) and not more than seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00). A separate offense shall be deemed committed for each day on which a
violation occurs or continues. Notwithstanding anything contained in this code, any court of competent jurisdiction shall be authorized to enter an order
of supervision or conditional discharge as provided by the Illinois unified code of corrections, 730 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/1-1-1 et seq.
B. For the purposes of this section, "person" shall mean and include any individual, corporation, association, partnership, or any other legal entity.
C. A default in the payment of any fine, or any unpaid installment thereof, imposed pursuant to any provisions of this code may be collected by any means
authorized for the collection of money judgments. Such attorney(s) for the village as designated by the village manager shall be and are authorized to
retain attorney(s) and private collection agent(s) for the purpose of collecting any default in the payment of any such fine, or any unpaid installment(s)
thereof, and any fees or costs incurred by the village with respect to such attorney(s) or private collection agent(s) retained by such attorney(s) for the
village for this purpose shall be an obligation of and be charged to the party or parties obligated to pay such fine or the unpaid installment(s) thereof.
(Ord. 09-3530, 7-20-2009)
1-4-2: APPLICATION OF PROVISIONS:
A. Application Of Penalty: The penalty provided in this chapter shall be applicable to every section of this code the same as though it were a part of each
and every separate section.
B. Acts Punishable Under Different Sections: In all cases where the same offense is made punishable or is created by different clauses or sections of this
code, the prosecuting officer may elect under which to proceed, but not more than one recovery shall be had against the same person for the same
offense; provided, that the revocation of a license or permit shall not be considered a recovery or penalty so as to bar any other penalty being enforced.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 30/522
C. Breach Of Provisions: Whenever the doing of any act or the omission to do any act constitutes a breach of any section or provision of this code and
there shall be no fine or penalty specifically declared for such breach, the provisions of this chapter shall apply. (2003 Code)
1-4-3: LIABILITY OF OFFICERS:
No provision of this code designating the duties of any officer or employee shall be so construed as to make such officer or employee liable for any fine or
penalty provided in this code for a failure to perform such duty, unless the intention of the board of trustees to impose such a fine or penalty on such officer
or employee is specifically and clearly expressed in the section creating the duty. (1973 Code § 1-11)
1-4-4: VILLAGE JAIL:
A. Jail Established: The place in the village heretofore established and used as the jail or any other place which may be hereafter used for that purpose, is
hereby declared to be the village jail. (1973 Code § 18-12)
B. Keeper; Custody Of Prisoners And Property: The chief of police shall be the keeper of the jail and shall have custody over all persons confined therein
and of all property pertaining thereto. (1973 Code § 18-13)
C. Use Of Jail: The jail shall be used for the incarceration of all persons arrested for violating any laws of the state of Illinois, the United States, or for
violating any village ordinance until such person shall be lawfully accorded a hearing or until such person shall be lawfully transferred to some other
place of incarceration or otherwise lawfully released; and for all persons committed for any offense for which a jail sentence is imposed or for
nonpayment of a fine for violation of a statute or ordinance as provided by statute. The police department will cooperate with other municipalities in
allowing their utilization of the jail. (1973 Code § 18-14)
Chapter 5
CORPORATE AUTHORITIES
1-5-1: VILLAGE PRESIDENT:
A. Elected Official; President Of Board Of Trustees: The village president shall be elected and serve the term provided by section 1-5-3 of this chapter, and
he shall be the president of the board of trustees as is provided by statutes.
B. Bond And Oath: Before entering upon the duties of his office, the president shall give a bond with sureties to be approved by the board of trustees
conditioned upon the faithful performance of his duties, in an amount not less than the amount required by statute for the village president. Such bond
shall be and remain on file in the office of the village clerk. The president shall take the oath of office as prescribed by statute.
C. Compensation:
1. Compensation Established: Beginning with the full term of office of the village president which commences as provided by law following the
municipal election to be held in April 2017, the village president shall thereafter receive no compensation for services as village president or for
services as local liquor commissioner. Until such time, the compensation of the village president shall remain as follows:
a. As village president three thousand six hundred dollars ($3,600.00) per year, which shall be paid in equal quarterly installments as provided in
subsection C2 of this section; and
b. As local liquor commissioner nine hundred dollars ($900.00) per year, which shall be paid in equal quarterly installments as provided in subsection
C2 of this section.
2. Dates Of Payments: Until such compensation is terminated as provided in subsection C1 of this section, such compensation shall continue to be
paid in equal quarterly installments.
D. General Duties: The president shall perform all duties required by statute or ordinance.
E. President Pro Tem: During the temporary absence or disability of the village president, the board of trustees shall elect one of its number to act as
president pro tem who, during the absence or disability of the president, shall perform the duties pertaining to the office. (Ord. 16-3903, 9-26-2016)
1-5-2: VILLAGE TRUSTEES:
A. Elected Officials; Term Of Office: Six (6) trustees shall be elected to the village board, and each shall serve a four (4) year term of office.
B. Oath Of Office: The members of the board of trustees shall take the oath of office prescribed by statutes.
C. Compensation:
1. Compensation Established: Beginning with the respective full term of office of each village trustee which commences as provided by law following
the municipal election to be held in April 2017, each village trustee shall thereafter receive no compensation for their respective services as village
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 31/522
trustee. Until such time, each village trustee shall receive one thousand two hundred dollars ($1,200.00) per year, which amount shall be paid in
equal quarterly installments as provided in subsection C2 of this section.
2. Dates Of Payments: Until the compensation of a trustee is terminated as provided in subsection C1 of this section, the compensation of such village
trustee shall continue to be paid in equal quarterly installments. (Ord. 16-3903, 9-26-2016)
1-5-3: COMMENCEMENT OF TERMS:
The terms of the Village President and members of the Board of Trustees shall commence at the first regular non-committee meeting of the Corporate
Authorities in May following the completion of the official canvass and after the proclamation of the results of the returns of the regular municipal election at
which such officers were elected. (Ord. 17-3941, 4-24-2017)
1-5-4: MEETINGS:
A. Regular Meetings: The Village Board of Trustees shall hold its regular meetings on the second and fourth Mondays of each month at eight o'clock (8:00)
P.M., unless otherwise provided by the Corporate Authorities. No notice of such regular meetings shall be required, except as provided by statute. The
meeting place of the Board shall be at the Village Hall, unless otherwise ordered by the Board. (1973 Code § 2-26; amd. 2003 Code)
B. Special And Emergency Meetings: Special and emergency meetings may be called by the President of the Village or any three (3) Trustees in the
manner provided by the statutes of the State. (Ord. 98-2751, 10-26-1998)
C. Open Meetings: All meetings shall be open to the public, except where otherwise directed by the Board, pursuant to law. (1973 Code § 2-26)
1-5-5: RULES OF PROCEDURE:
A. Robert's Rules Of Order: "Robert's Rules Of Order" shall govern the deliberations of the Board of Trustees except when in conflict with this Code.
B. Quorum, Vote Required: A majority of the Corporate Authorities shall constitute a quorum to do business, but no ordinance shall be passed except upon
the favorable vote of a majority of all members then holding office, including the President, as provided by statutes.
C. Order Of Business:
1. The order of business of the Board of Trustees shall be as follows:
a. Roll call.
b. Approval of minutes of the preceding meeting.
c. Other matters in the order set forth in the agenda.
d. Adjournment.
2. The Corporate Authorities by majority vote can change the order of business.
D. Disturbing Meetings: It shall be unlawful for any person to disturb any meeting of the Board of Trustees or of any Committee thereof.
E. Suspension Of Rules: The rules of order, other than those prescribed by statutes, may be suspended at any time by consent of a majority of the
members present at any meeting.
F. Content Of Minutes; Approval:
1. The Village Board of Trustees' minutes are intended to reflect the action of the Village Board of Trustees and comments, in summary form, from the
audience. Comments of any Trustee will be included, in summary, on the specific request of the Trustee.
2. The draft minutes will be presented with the agenda material for approval at the next regular Board meeting. Any Trustee desiring to correct or
elaborate on the draft minutes shall make a motion stating the matters to be corrected or elaborated on; such motion shall be voted upon by the
Trustees, if seconded. (Ord. 11-3618, 2-14-2011)
1-5-6: COMMITTEES:
A. Committees Created: There are hereby created the following Standing Committees of the Corporate Authorities:
Committee of the Whole
Communications Committee
Development Committee
Finance Committee
Infrastructure Committee
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 32/522
B. Committee Functions Defined: The Committees created in this section shall have the following responsibilities, and such other responsibilities as may
from time to time be assigned by the village president:
1. Committee Of The Whole: The responsibilities of the committee of the whole will not be limited in any way by subject matter.
2. Communications Committee: Oversight over messaging from the village to village residents, including, but not limited to, messaging relative to
emergency management preparation, and responsibility for media review. Monitor and periodically update village website. Review complaint process
and its timeliness.
3. Development Committee: Review of items pertaining to comprehensive plan and other planning issues, zoning, architectural review, historic district
review, review of permit process and its timeliness, review of related boards and commissions and secure related feedback, issues related to
housing and livability, and economic development including, but not limited to, policy issues relating to staffing, cost recovery, proposed changes to
the zoning and subdivision ordinances and special projects. Responsibilities shall also include the review of and recommendations on all proposed
"village initiated" petitions.
4. Finance Committee: Review of items pertaining to the operation of the department of financial services including, but not limited to, policy issues
relating to finance, budget, audit, data processing, personnel, insurance and legal services. Committee responsibilities shall also include the review
of and recommendations on alternative revenue sources and/or adjustments to existing fees/rates, budget amendments and review and payment of
statements pertaining to legal services. This committee is responsible for the periodic review of and oversight over the Barrington White House and
the Barrington White House fund. This committee is also responsible for special projects relating to the department of financial services which shall
include, but not be limited to, the recodification of this code.
5. Infrastructure Committee: Review of items pertaining to public works including, but not limited to, policy issues relating to streets, sidewalks, forestry,
storm and sanitary systems, water distribution system, recycling and refuse and municipal property, capital project review, five (5) year infrastructure
plan, transportation, beautification, senior friendly, issues related to livability, accessibility, and commuter parking policies. (Ord. 15-3864, 10-12-
2015)
C. Membership: Subsequent to the election and assumption of office of the newly elected members of the corporate authorities in each odd numbered
calendar year and subject to the approval of the board of trustees by motion made and duly passed, the president shall appoint three (3) members of
the board of trustees as members of each committee and shall select one of such members to serve as the chairperson of each committee created by
this section. Members shall serve on the committees to which they are appointed for a term of two (2) years or until their successors are appointed and
qualified. The president shall be an ex officio member of each committee. A quorum shall consist of two (2) members of a committee; provided,
however the president, as an ex officio member, shall not be counted as a member for purposes of determining if a quorum is present.
D. Subcommittees:
1. Creation And Dissolution: The corporate authorities shall have the power exercised by resolution to create new subcommittees to the committees
created by this section and to dissolve existing subcommittees.
2. Membership And Appointment: Subject to the approval of the board of trustees by motion made and duly passed, the president shall have the
authority to determine the number of members on each subcommittee and to appoint the members and the chairperson thereof.
3. Eligibility: Persons who are members of the board of trustees as well as persons who are not members of the board of trustees are eligible to serve
as members of subcommittees.
4. Terms: The term of each member of a subcommittee, if not terminated sooner, shall end on the second Monday of April in each odd numbered
calendar year or when their successors are appointed and qualified.
5. President Ex Officio Member: The president shall be an ex officio member of each subcommittee.
6. Quorum: A quorum shall consist of the majority of the total number of members on a subcommittee. The president, as an ex officio member of each
subcommittee, shall not be counted as a member for purposes of determining if a quorum is present.
E. Procedure: "Robert's Rules Of Order" shall govern the deliberation of all committees and subcommittees except when in conflict with this code.
F. Scope: Nothing in this section shall be deemed to limit the authority of the corporate authorities to constitute advisory or other committees not comprised
solely of members of the corporate authorities, nor shall it be deemed to dissolve any such advisory committees, other committees or subcommittees
existing at the effective date hereof. (Ord. 95-2569, 8-28-1995)
1-5-7: HIRE AND DISCHARGE EMPLOYEES:
The corporate authorities shall hire and discharge all employees of the village of Barrington, provided that this authority shall not extend to members of the
police or fire departments who shall be subject to appointment, suspension, and removal by the board of fire and police commissioners, with the exception
of the chief of police and assistant chief of police as provided in section 1-7B-2 of this title, and with the exception of the chief of fire/EMS and deputy chief
of fire/EMS as provided in section 1-7C-2 of this title. (Ord. 12-3729, 12-17-2012)
Chapter 6
VILLAGE OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES
1-6-1: APPLICATION OF PROVISIONS:
The provisions of this chapter shall apply alike to all officers and employees of the village regardless of the time of the creation of the office or position or
the time of the appointment of the officer or employee. (1973 Code § 2-78)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 33/522
1-6-2: ELECTIONS:
Elections for municipal offices shall be held as provided by 10 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/1-1 et seq., and at the time prescribed by said statute. (1973
Code § 2-3; amd. 2003 Code)
1-6-3: APPOINTIVE OFFICERS; TERMS AND VACANCIES:
A. Terms Of Office; Vacancies: Every appointive officer of the village shall hold office until January 1 following his appointment or until his successor is
appointed and qualified, except as otherwise provided by Illinois statutes, this code, or other village ordinance. In case of a vacancy in any such office,
it shall be filled in the same manner in which appointments or selections are made, in the absence of any provision to the contrary.
B. Duration Of Temporary Appointments: Except as otherwise provided by 65 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/3.1-10-50 with respect to appointments to fill
vacancies in the office of trustee:
1. In those circumstances in which the village president has the authority under law to make temporary appointments of municipal officers without the
advice and consent of the board of trustees, the term of the temporary appointee shall not exceed an initial period of sixty (60) days.
2. At the expiration of the aforesaid sixty (60) day period, if the position has not been filled with an appointment for the full term (or the unexpired
portion of the term) with the advice and consent of the board of trustees, the village president may make a temporary appointment for an additional
period of thirty (30) days of any person including the person who is temporarily appointed for the initial sixty (60) day period.
3. At the expiration of the aforesaid period of thirty (30) days, the village president shall submit a new name for appointment for the full term (or the
unexpired portion of the term) for consideration by the board of trustees.
4. No temporary appointment of any one person shall be made more than twice in one fiscal (calendar) year. (Ord. 11-3625, 4-25-2011)
1-6-4: OATH OF OFFICE:
A. Oath Required: Every officer of the village shall, before entering upon his duties, take the oath prescribed by statute. (1973 Code § 2-81)
B. Administering Oaths: In addition to the municipal officers designated in 65 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/3.1-15-20 as officers authorized to administer
oaths (i.e., the president, the clerk, the chairman of the plan commission, and the chairman of the zoning board of appeals), the following municipal
officers of the village are hereby designated as municipal officers authorized to administer oaths and affirmations on all lawful occasions:
1. The chairperson and the acting chairperson of the architectural review commission;
2. The acting chairperson of the plan commission;
3. The Chairperson and the Acting Chairperson of the Village Center Redevelopment Commission;
4. The Chairperson of the Fire and Police Commission; and
5. The Deputy Clerk. (Ord. 01-2935, 5-14-2001)
1-6-5: DUTIES:
A. Turn In Monies Received: Every officer of the Village shall, as required by the Manager, turn over all money received by him in his official capacity to the
Treasurer with a statement showing the source from which the same was received. (1973 Code § 2-80)
B. Termination Of Office Or Employment; Property To Successor: Every officer and employee of the Village, upon the expiration of his term for any cause
whatsoever, shall deliver all books and records which may be the property of the Village to the Village Clerk. (2003 Code)
1-6-6: RECORDS AVAILABLE FOR INSPECTION:
All public records kept by any officer of the Village in accordance with resolution 889, shall be open to inspection by the Manager, the President, or any
member of the Board of Trustees at all reasonable times, whether or not such records are required to be kept by statute or ordinance. (1973 Code § 2-82;
amd. 2003 Code)
1-6-7: CLASSIFICATION AND COMPENSATION PLAN:
The official pay plan shall be adopted annually or at the time the Board of Trustees considers the budget ordinance. (2003 Code)
1-6-8: EMPLOYMENT POLICY:
A. Authority To Employ Personnel: Authority to employ individuals for all positions in the Village service, except police officers and firefighters/paramedics,
is vested in the Corporate Authorities. (Ord. 05-3246, 6-13-2005)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 34/522
B. Employment Procedure:
1. It is the policy of the Village to employ and fill vacancies on the basis of merit and fitness, and insofar as possible in the interests of the Village, to
promote Village employees to higher positions when vacancies occur.
2. All persons seeking employment with the Village shall make application on forms provided. No person will be employed and placed on the Village
payroll until appropriate and satisfactory character, qualifications, and medical examination have been completed and information necessary for
pension plan, payroll deductions and other required data are determined.
C. Recruitment; Equal Employment Opportunity: All employees are selected on the basis of merit, character, training, experience, physical fitness, and
compliance with applicable retirement and pension plan requirements. It is the policy of the Village not to discriminate against a person because of
race, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, or other protected characteristic. Every person
will be given an equal opportunity for employment with the Village, and the Village shall comply strictly with all State and Federal labor laws and
legislation.
D. Residency Requirement: Although highly desirable, employees are not required to maintain residences within the Village limits. (2003 Code)
1-6-9: PERSONNEL POLICY:
The Personnel Policy Manual of the Village, in its amended and restated form dated November 26, 2018, is hereby approved, adopted, and incorporated
by reference as if set out herein in its entirety, effective on said date. A copy of said Personnel Policy Manual dated November 26, 2018 is on file in the
Office of the Village Clerk for public reference and inspection. (Ord. 18-4030, 11-26-2018)
1-6-10: PARTICIPATION IN ILLINOIS MUNICIPAL RETIREMENT FUND:
The Corporate Authorities elected to participate in the Illinois Municipal Retirement Fund effective January 1, 1968. (1973 Code § 2-4; amd. 2003 Code)
Chapter 7
DEPARTMENTS
1-7-1: DEPARTMENTS ESTABLISHED:
The operations of the village shall be divided under the village manager into the following departments and managers thereof:
Department Department Manager
Financial services Director of financial services
Police Chief of police
Fire Chief of fire/EMS
Public works Director of public works
Development services Director of development services
Economic development Director of economic development
Human resources and risk management Manager of human resources and risk management
(Ord. 15-3837, 6-8-2015)
1-7-2: DEPARTMENT MANAGEMENT:
Each department manager shall perform the duties required by this code and the ordinances of the village and such other duties required by the corporate
authorities. In addition, the managers of each of the respective departments shall:
A. Be immediately responsible to the village manager for the effective administration of their respective departments and all activities assigned thereto.
B. Keep informed as to the latest practices in their particular field and shall put into place, with the approval of the village manager, such new practices as
appear to be of benefit to the service of the village and to the public at large.
C. Submit departmental reports to the village manager as required.
D. Establish and maintain a system of filing and indexing records and reports in sufficient detail to furnish all information necessary for proper control of
departmental activities and to form a basis for the period reports submitted to the village manager.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 35/522
E. When authorized by the village manager, have power to discipline departmental staff, subject to the personnel regulations of the village.
F. Be responsible for the proper maintenance of all village property and equipment used in their respective departments. (Ord. 05-3246, 6-13-2005)
1-7-3: COOPERATE WITH OTHER DEPARTMENTS:
Each department shall fully cooperate with all other departments and officers of the village and shall furnish, upon the direction of the village manager, any
other departments and officers such service, labor and materials as may be requested by the manager of such departments or officers and as facilities
shall reasonably permit. (2003 Code; amd. Ord. 05-3246, 6-13-2005)
ARTICLE A. DEPARTMENT OF FINANCIAL SERVICES
1-7A-1: DEPARTMENT ESTABLISHED; COMPOSITION:
There is hereby established a department of the village to be known as the department of financial services. The department manager shall be the director
of financial services. The department shall consist of the director and such additional personnel as shall be deemed necessary from time to time to provide
the services required of the department, as allowed within the fiscal year budget or upon approval by the corporate authorities. (Ord. 15-3837, 6-8-2015)
1-7A-2: FUNCTIONS, DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
The functions, duties, and responsibilities of the department of financial services shall include, but shall not be limited to, the following:
A. To maintain and oversee all financial systems and to prepare all financial reports for the village, and to coordinate all internal and external budgets, tax
levies, and audit processes and to develop and administer customer service programs.
B. To keep such records and make such reports concerning the activities of the department as may be required by statute or ordinance, and to perform
such other functions, duties, and responsibilities as assigned. (Ord. 15-3837, 6-8-2015)
ARTICLE B. POLICE DEPARTMENT1
1-7B-1: DEPARTMENT CREATED; COMPOSITION:
There is hereby established a police department for the village. The department manager as described in section 1-7-2 of this chapter shall be the chief of
police, an officer and employee of the village who shall be appointed as provided in section 1-7B-2 of this article. The department shall consist of the chief
of police and such additional personnel and positions as shall be deemed necessary from time to time to provide the services required of the department,
as allowed within the fiscal year budget or as otherwise approved by the corporate authorities. (Ord. 08-3448, 6-9-2008)
1-7B-2: CHIEF OF POLICE; ASSISTANT CHIEF OF POLICE; FUNCTIONS, DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
A. Office Created; Appointment And Removal: There is created within the village of Barrington the office, position, and exempt rank of chief of police. The
chief of police shall be appointed and/or removed by the village president with the advice and consent of the corporate authorities, provided that if the
person appointed as chief of police was at the time of such appointment a member of the department, he shall retain his status and rank while serving
as chief of police and shall revert to such status and rank when his tenure as chief of police has ended.
B. Functions, Duties, And Responsibilities, Generally: The chief of police shall be the department manager and ranking officer of the police department,
with such functions, duties, and responsibilities as provided in section 1-7-2 of this chapter. The chief of police shall be responsible to, report to, and be
subject to the direction of the village manager. The chief shall be responsible for the performance by the police department of all its functions, duties,
and responsibilities, and all persons who are members of the department shall serve subject to the orders of the chief of police.
C. Assistant Chief Of Police: There is hereby created the office, position and exempt rank which shall be designated as "assistant chief of police", which
shall be immediately below the rank of the chief of police, pursuant to the authority provided by 65 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/10-2.1-4 to create one or
more deputy chief(s) of police. There shall be no more than one assistant chief of police. The assistant chief of police may be appointed by the chief of
police from any rank of sworn, full time officers of the police department, but such sworn, full time officer must have at least five (5) years of full time
service as a police officer in the police department. An assistant chief of police shall serve at the discretion of the chief of police and, if removed from
the position, shall revert to the rank currently held, without regard to whether or not a vacancy exists in that rank. The assistant chief of police shall
perform such functions, duties, and responsibilities as may be assigned to him from time to time by the chief of police. (Ord. 12-3729, 12-17-2012)
1-7B-3: FUNCTIONS, DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF DEPARTMENT:
The functions, duties, and responsibilities of the police department shall include, but shall not be limited to, the following:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 36/522
A. To enforce all village ordinances and all applicable statutes, to preserve order and prevent infraction of the law and arrest violators thereof, to conduct
themselves in a proper and law abiding manner and avoid the use of unnecessary force, and to be the keeper of the jail and the custodian of all
persons confined therein.
B. To keep such records and make such reports concerning the activities of the department as may be required by statute and ordinance, and to perform
such other functions, duties, and responsibilities as assigned. (Ord. 08-3448, 6-9-2008)
1-7B-4: AGE RESTRICTIONS FOR MEMBERS OF POLICE DEPARTMENT:
The minimum age requirements for sworn members of the police department are governed by the rules and regulations of the board of fire and police
commissioners of the village. The mandatory age for retirement of sworn members of the police department in the service of the village shall be sixty five
(65) years of age. (Ord. 08-3448, 6-9-2008)
ARTICLE C. FIRE DEPARTMENT1
1-7C-1: DEPARTMENT CREATED; COMPOSITION:
There is hereby established a fire department for the village. The department manager as described in section 1-7-2 of this chapter shall be the chief of
fire/EMS, an officer and employee of the village and shall be appointed as provided in section 1-7C-2 of this article. The department shall consist of the
chief of fire/EMS ("emergency medical services") and any such additional personnel and positions as shall be deemed necessary from time to time to
provide the services required of the department, as allowed within the fiscal year budget or as otherwise approved by the corporate authorities. (Ord. 08-
3448, 6-9-2008)
1-7C-2: CHIEF OF FIRE/EMS; FUNCTIONS, DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
A. Office Created; Appointment And Removal: There is hereby created the office of chief of fire/EMS, an administrative office and position of employment
in the village. The chief of fire/EMS shall be appointed and removed by the village president with the advice and consent of the corporate authorities,
provided, however, that if the person appointed as chief of fire/EMS was at the time of such appointment a member of the department, he shall retain
his status and rank while serving as chief of fire/EMS and shall revert to such status and rank when his tenure as chief of fire/EMS has ended.
B. Functions, Duties, And Responsibilities: The chief of fire/EMS shall be the department manager and ranking officer of the fire department with such
functions, duties, and responsibilities as provided in section 1-7-2 of this chapter. The chief of fire/EMS shall be responsible to, report to, and be subject
to the direction of the village manager. The chief of fire/EMS shall be responsible for the performance by the fire department of all its functions, duties,
and responsibilities, and all persons who are members of the department shall serve subject to the orders of the chief of fire/EMS.
C. Deputy Chief Of Fire/EMS: There is hereby created the office, position of employment and exempt administrative rank of deputy chief of fire/EMS,
which shall be immediately below the rank of the chief of fire/EMS. There shall be no more than one deputy chief of fire/EMS. The deputy chief of
fire/EMS may be appointed by the chief of fire/EMS from any rank of sworn, full time officers of the fire department. A deputy chief of fire/EMS shall
serve at the discretion of the chief of fire/EMS and, if removed from the position, shall revert to the rank currently held, without regard to whether or not
a vacancy exists in that rank. The deputy chief of fire/EMS shall perform such functions, duties, and responsibilities as may be assigned to him from
time to time by the chief of fire/EMS.
D. Fire Official: The "fire official", as that term is used in this chapter and in this code, shall mean the chief of fire/EMS or any member of the fire
department or any employee of the village designated by the chief of fire/EMS to perform the functions, duties, and responsibilities herein designated.
(Ord. 08-3448, 6-9-2008)
1-7C-3: FIRE DEPARTMENT FUNCTIONS, DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
The functions, duties, and responsibilities of the fire department shall include, but shall not be limited to, the following:
A. To provide emergency services in the case of fire, rescue, EMS, hazardous material, and/or other emergencies, to provide fire prevention, code
enforcement, inspectional and community education services.
B. To keep such records and make such reports concerning the activities of the department as may be required by statute or ordinance, and to perform
such other functions, duties, and responsibilities as assigned. (Ord. 08-3448, 6-9-2008)
1-7C-4: AGE RESTRICTIONS FOR MEMBERS OF FIRE DEPARTMENT:
The minimum age requirements for sworn members of the fire department are governed by the rules and regulations of the board of fire and police
commissioners of the village. The mandatory age for retirement of sworn members of the fire department in the service of the village shall be sixty five (65)
years of age. (Ord. 08-3448, 6-9-2008)
