restrictions. When instructed by the police department that a vehicle in storage must be secured from tampering, the operator shall store said vehicle so
that it is not accessible to any person except upon specific approval of the tow operator or his agent. A clearance of twenty four inches (24") must be
maintained around all vehicles from the tow rotation list calls. (Ord. 15-3873, 12-14-2015)
6-11-13: TOW OPERATOR PERSONNEL QUALIFICATIONS:
No person who has been convicted under the laws of this state or any other state of an offense which under the laws of the state of Illinois would be a
felony theft of a vehicle or a felony offense under article 1, chapter 4 of the Illinois vehicle code, shall be approved as a tow operator to be placed on the
tow rotation list, nor shall any tow operator knowingly permit such a person to operate a tow truck on the tow rotation list calls; provided, however, that a
person whose last conviction was more than four (4) years past, and who has shown evidence of rehabilitation, may be approved if otherwise eligible.
Each tow operator shall furnish to the police department a complete and current list of all drivers who may respond to tow rotation list calls. No driver shall
be permitted to respond to any tow rotation list call unless his name, date of birth and driver's license number have been furnished to the police
department at least twenty four (24) hours in advance by the tow operator on forms provided by the police department. (Ord. 15-3873, 12-14-2015)
6-11-14: DEPARTMENT TOW PROCEDURES:
The following procedures shall be followed when initiating the towing of a vehicle:
A. Whenever a police officer initiates a tow of a vehicle, the officer shall contact the Barrington police department and inform the watch commander of the
department then on duty that a tow has been authorized. The Barrington police department shall then select a towing service from the Barrington police
department's tow rotation list and shall contact that towing service directly by phone, computer, dispatch, or similar means. Towing services shall be
contacted in the order listed on the appropriate tow rotation list, at which point the towing service shall be placed at the end of that tow rotation list. In
the event a listed towing service is not available, the next listed towing service on that tow rotation list shall be contacted.
B. The Barrington police department may deviate from the order listed on a tow rotation list if the towing service next on that tow rotation list is, in the
judgment of the authorizing officer or the watch commander of the department then on duty making the selection, incapable of or not properly equipped
for handling a specific task related to the tow that requires special skills or equipment. A deviation from the order listed on the tow rotation list for this
reason shall not cause a loss of rotation turn by the towing service determined to be incapable or not properly equipped for handling the request.
C. In the event of an emergency, an officer or the watch commander of the department then on duty, taking into account the safety and location of the
situation, may deviate from the order of the tow rotation list and obtain towing service from any source deemed appropriate.
D. If the owner or operator of a disabled vehicle is present at the scene of the disabled vehicle, is not under arrest, and does not abandon his or her
vehicle, and in the officer's opinion the disabled vehicle is not impeding or obstructing traffic, illegally parked, or posing a security or safety risk, the
officer shall allow the owner of the vehicle to specify a towing service to relocate the disabled vehicle. If the owner chooses not to specify a towing
service, the officer or the watch commander of the department then on duty shall select a towing service for the vehicle as provided in subsection A of
this section.
E. If a tow operator is present or arrives where a tow is needed and it has not been requested by the officer or the watch commander of the department
then on duty, or the owner or operator, the officer, unless acting under one of the exceptions set forth in section 11-1431 of the Illinois motor vehicle
code3, shall advise the tow operator to leave the scene. (Ord. 15-3873, 12-14-2015)
6-11-15: VIOLATION AND PENALTY:
Any person, firm, or corporation who is found guilty of violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined as provided in section 1-4-1 of this code
for each offense. (Ord. 15-3873, 12-14-2015)
6-11-16: TERMINATION OF ROTATION TOW PROCEDURE:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 278/522
The village reserves the right to terminate its rotation tow procedure unilaterally at any time without any notice and without recourse. (Ord. 15-3873, 12-14-
2015)
Title 7
PUBLIC WAYS AND PROPERTY
Chapter 1
STREETS, SIDEWALKS AND OTHER PUBLIC WAYS
7-1-1: SUPERVISION:
All public streets, alleys, sidewalks, parkways and other public property dedicated to, owned by, and/or under the maintenance jurisdiction of the village
(sometimes collectively referred to in this chapter as "public way(s)") shall be under the supervision of the village manager, or his or her designee. He or
she shall have supervision over all work thereon, and the maintenance thereof, and shall be charged with the enforcement of all ordinance provisions
relating to such public way(s) (except traffic ordinances) and is hereby authorized to enforce such ordinances. (Ord. 08-3442, 4-14-2008)
7-1-2: FEES FOR PERMIT:
Nonrefundable application fee(s) for such license and/or permit for obstructions and encroachments of public ways, and for opening, excavation and/or
other construction activity in, on, upon, over, across and/or through any public way(s) shall be paid to the village by the applicant at the time such
application is submitted to the village for any license and/or permit as required by this chapter as specified from time to time in section 1-14-1 of this code.
(Ord. 09-3495, 2-9-2009)
7-1-3: BUILDING NUMBERING:
A. Numbering Required: It shall be the duty of the owners and occupants of the principal building on any lot or parcel of ground in the village to have
placed thereon, in a place visible from the street, figures at least two and one-half inches (21/2") high, showing the number of the building. Any person
failing to so number any building after receiving notice to do so from the village manager, or his or her designee, shall be in violation of this code and
shall be subject to such fines and penalties as provided in section 1-4-1 of this code and each day such violation exists or is permitted to exist shall
constitute a separate offense.
B. Chart: The village manager, or his or her designee, shall keep a chart showing the proper street number of every lot in the village which shall be open to
inspection by anyone interested. (Ord. 08-3442, 4-14-2008)
7-1-4: OPENINGS OR OTHER ALTERATIONS IN PUBLIC WAYS:
A. Permit Required: It shall be unlawful to construct or maintain any opening or stairway in or otherwise alter any public way(s) without a permit from the
village manager, or his or her designee.
B. Safety Factors: All lawfully maintained openings shall be guarded by a suitable strong cover or railing, to the approval of the village manager, or his or
her designee. (Ord. 08-3442, 4-14-2008)
7-1-5: PARKING REGULARLY; LICENSE REQUIREMENTS:
A. License Required; Fee: The corporate authorities may, by resolution or ordinance, authorize a written license for a term of not less than one year and
not more than two (2) years for any portion of a public way not presently required for use by the village; provided, however, that any such license shall
include the following provisions:
1. That fees for the use of said property shall be as determined by the corporate authorities from time to time; and
2. That such property shall be used exclusively for parking purposes.
B. Conditions Of License: Such licenses shall be executed only where:
1. Approved as to specific location by the corporate authorities; and
2. The corporate authorities find that there is an improved street sufficient to accommodate both ordinary vehicular traffic and the proposed parking
and/or where, as additional consideration for such a license, the proposed licensee agrees to improve the right of way, including, but not limited to,
pavement, curb and gutter and storm drainage, as the village manager, or his or her designee, may recommend to conform such improvements to
the right of way standards of the applicable village ordinances.
C. Improvements: Any such improvements by the lessee as aforesaid shall be made only after the execution of a written license and only after there has
been submitted to the village manager, or his or her designee, for his or her prior approval a site plan indicating compliance with the standards of the
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 279/522
applicable village ordinances. The site plan shall further include, when appropriate, specifications relative to the dimensions and angle of the proposed
parking spaces and stormwater retention, landscaping, or lighting to be part of the proposed improvements.
D. Maintenance Of Parking Area; Hours: Any such license shall specify whether the village or the licensee shall be responsible for the maintenance of the
subject portions of the right of way and shall further specify whether the provisions of subsection 6-3-5C of this code, relative to prohibited parking
between the hours of one o'clock (1:00) A.M. and six o'clock (6:00) A.M., shall apply to the subject portions of the public way(s). Any waiver of the
application of subsection 6-3-5C of this code shall also be expressly approved by the corporate authorities.
E. Renewal Of License: Renewal of any such license shall be approved by the corporate authorities. (Ord. 08-3442, 4-14-2008)
F. Digital Data Standards: All submittals to the village and/or to any engineer, architect, surveyor, or other consultant retained by the village as required by
this section shall comply with the village's digital data standards set forth in title 1, chapter 16, "Digital Data Standards", of this code. (Ord. 09-3536, 8-
17-2009)
7-1-6: USE OF PUBLIC WAYS:
A. Sale Or Display Of Merchandise: It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to use any public way(s) as space for the sale or display of
goods or merchandise for sale; or to write or mark, or to place any signs or advertisements on any such public way(s) except as may be specifically
authorized by the corporate authorities, by the village manager or his or her designee, by a current and valid mobile food vendor license, or by a
current and valid special event permit. (Ord. 12-3693, 6-25-2012)
B. Franchise Agreements: Except as otherwise provided by this code or by any applicable preemptive state or federal law, no person, firm, company,
corporation or association shall construct, install, maintain or operate any utility, public utility, and/or telecommunication equipment and facilities
including, but not limited to, poles, wires, fiber optic cables, underground conduits, ducts, pipes, manholes and other structures or appurtenances in,
upon, along, across, above, over, under, through, or in any manner connected with the public way(s) within the corporate limits of the village unless a
franchise agreement has first been obtained.
C. Right Of Way Use License: Except as otherwise provided by this code or by any applicable preemptive state or federal law, any person, whether an
individual, firm, corporation, or other entity, other than the village, shall be required to apply for and obtain from the village a right of way use license in
order to construct, install, operate, maintain, or otherwise locate facilities in, upon, along, under, over, above, across or through any specific public
way(s) under the jurisdiction of the village, for the purpose of constructing private facilities.
1. Application: Any such person that desires a right of way use license pursuant to this section shall file an application with the village on forms to be
provided by the village manager, or his or her designee, which shall include the following information:
a. The identity of the applicant, including all affiliates of the applicant.
b. A description of the proposed facilities and the service(s), if any, that are or will be offered or provided by licensee over or through its facilities.
c. Preliminary engineering plans, specifications and a map of all of the proposed facilities of the applicant to be located within the village shall
identify:
(1) The location and route requested for applicant's proposed facilities.
(2) The location of all overhead and underground public utility, cable, water, sewer drainage and other facilities in the public way along the
proposed route.
(3) The location(s), if any, for interconnection with the facilities of any other persons.
(4) The specific trees, landscaping, structures, improvements, facilities and obstructions, if any, that applicant proposes to temporarily or
permanently remove or relocate.
d. A preliminary construction schedule and completion date.
e. A preliminary traffic control plan in accordance with the Illinois department of transportation (IDOT) "Manual On Uniform Traffic Control Devices".
f. Information in sufficient detail to establish the technical qualifications, experience and expertise of the applicant, or the applicant's contractor,
regarding the installation, maintenance, and operation of the facilities described in the application.
g. Information to establish that the applicant has obtained all other governmental approvals, permits and certifications to construct and operate the
facilities.
h. The preliminary engineering plans shall also demonstrate to the satisfaction of the village manager, or his or her designee, that the proposed
facilities shall not interfere with or impede safe sight distances within, on, or adjacent to any public way(s) and that the proposed location of such
facilities shall be a reasonably safe distance from the edge of pavement and from the back of curb, if applicable. (Ord. 08-3442, 4-14-2008)
i. A nonrefundable right of way license application fee as specified from time to time in section 1-14-1 of this code shall be paid to the village by the
applicant at the time such application is submitted to the village. (Ord. 09-3495, 2-9-2009)
j. Such other and further information as may be required by the village manager, or his or her designee.
2. Determination By The Village: Within a reasonable time after receiving a complete application under this section, including any and all required
supporting information and documentation, the corporate authorities shall, exercising its sole discretion, issue a written determination granting or
denying the application in whole or in part, and applying the following standards. If the application is denied, the written determination shall include
the reasons for denial.
a. The capacity of the public ways to accommodate the applicant's proposed facilities.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 280/522
b. The capacity of the public ways to accommodate such facilities if the license is granted.
c. The damage or disruption, if any, of public or private facilities, improvements, services, travel or landscaping if the license is granted.
d. The public interest in minimizing the cost and disruption of construction within the public ways.
e. The effect, if any, on public health, safety and welfare if the license is granted.
f. The availability of alternate routes and/or locations for the proposed facilities.
g. Applicable federal and state laws, regulations and policies.
h. Lack of a mutually agreeable license agreement.
i. Such other factors as may demonstrate that the grant for private use of the public ways will not serve the community interest.
3. Written Agreement: No license granted hereunder shall be effective until the applicant and the village have executed a written agreement, approved
by the corporate authorities by an ordinance or resolution, acting in its sole discretion, and accepted in writing by the applicant, setting forth the
particular terms and provisions under which the license to occupy and use public ways will be granted. The provisions of this section establish the
minimum requirements for such a license, if granted, and do not preclude any additional terms agreed upon.
4. Nonexclusive Grant: No license granted under this section shall confer any exclusive right, privilege, license or franchise to occupy or use the public
ways for any other purposes.
5. Rights Granted: No license granted under this section shall convey any right, title or interest in the public ways, but shall be deemed a license only to
temporarily use and occupy the public ways for the limited purposes and term stated in the license granted. Further, no license shall be construed as
any warranty of title.
6. Term Of License Grant: Unless otherwise specified in a license agreement, a right of way use license granted hereunder shall be in effect for an
indefinite term, and even if a definite term is specified, shall, in any event, be terminable, at any time, without cause, at the sole discretion of the
corporate authorities.
7. License Route: A right of way use license granted under this section shall be limited to only those specific public ways as defined in such license.
8. Location Of Facilities: Unless otherwise specified in a license agreement, all facilities shall be constructed, installed and located in substantial
accordance with those plans and specifications as approved by the village manager, or his or her designee.
9. General Standards: Obstruction(s) or facilities, if approved in the sole discretion of the corporate authorities pursuant to a right of way license, shall
generally be limited to three feet (3') or less in height as measured from the existing level of the public way(s) at the proposed location and shall
generally be not less than five feet (5') from the edge of pavement and not less than five feet (5') from the back of curb, if applicable.
10. Construction Permits: All licensees are required to obtain construction permits for facilities as required in this code, provided, however, that nothing
in this section shall prohibit the village and a licensee from agreeing in writing to alternative plan review, permit and construction procedures in a
license agreement, provided such alternative procedures provide substantially equivalent safeguards for responsible construction practices.
11. Amendment To Right Of Way License:
a. Any person desiring to modify a license area or extend the term of right of way license, or modify or extend or locate its facilities in public ways
which are not included in a previous license granted under this section, shall be required to apply for a new right of way license and complete and
file with the village manager, or his or her designee, a new license application.
b. If the holder of a current right of way license with the village is ordered by the village to locate or relocate its facilities in, upon, along, across,
above, over, under, through, or in any manner connected with public ways not included in a previously granted license, the village shall grant an
amendment to said license for such required location or relocation without the license holder having to make any further application to the village
for said modifications or, in the alternative, at its sole discretion, the village may terminate the existing license.
c. The village manager, or his or her designee, shall be permitted to approve in writing appropriate field changes requested by a licensee in the plans
and specifications approved by the village, without requiring an amendment to the license agreement. Decisions on requests by a licensee for field
changes shall be made within a reasonable time after the licensee provides all information and/or documentation requested by the village
manager, or his or her designee.
12. Renewal Applications: A licensee that desires to renew its license under this section shall file an application with the village, on forms to be
provided by the village manager, or his or her designee, for renewal, which shall include the following information:
a. The information required pursuant to this section.
b. Any information required pursuant to the existing license agreement between the village and the licensee.
13. Renewal Determinations: Within a reasonable time after receiving a complete license application, including any and all required supporting
information and documentation, the corporate authorities, acting in its sole discretion, will issue a written determination granting or denying the
renewal application in whole or in part, applying the same standards set forth in this section which would be considered for an application for a new
license. If the renewal application is denied, the written determination shall include the reasons for such denial.
14. Obligation To Cure As A Condition Of Renewal: No right of way license shall be renewed until any and all violations or defaults in the licensee's
performance of the existing license agreement, as the case may be, or of the requirements of this section, have been cured, or a plan detailing the
corrective action to be taken has been approved in advance in writing by the village manager, or his or her designee.
15. Duty To Provide Information: Within ten (10) days of a written request from the village manager, or his or her designee, each licensee shall furnish
the village with information sufficient to demonstrate:
a. That licensee has complied with all requirements of this section.
b. That all village taxes and fees due the village in connection with the facility services and facilities provided by the licensee have been properly
collected and paid by the licensee.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 281/522
c. All books, records, maps and other documents, maintained by the licensee with respect to its facilities located in, upon, along, across, above, over,
under, through, or in any manner connected with the public ways shall be made available for inspection by the village at reasonable times and
intervals.
16. Licensee Insurance: Unless otherwise provided in a license agreement, each licensee, and any contractor or subcontractor thereof, shall, as a
condition of the grant of any right of way license, secure and keep in force the following liability insurance policies insuring both the licensee and the
village, and its elected and appointed officers, officials, agents and employees as additional insureds:
a. Comprehensive general liability insurance with limits not less than:
(1) One million dollars ($1,000,000.00) for bodily injury or death to each person;
(2) One million dollars ($1,000,000.00) for property damage resulting from any one accident; and
(3) One million dollars ($1,000,000.00) for all other types of liability.
b. Automobile liability for owned, nonowned and hired vehicles with a limit of one million dollars ($1,000,000.00) for each person and one million
dollars ($1,000,000.00) for each accident.
c. Workers' compensation within statutory limits and employer's liability insurance with limits of not less than one million dollars ($1,000,000.00).
d. Comprehensive form premises-operations, explosions and collapse hazard, underground hazard and products-completed hazard with limits of not
less than one million dollars ($1,000,000.00).
e. The liability insurance policies required by this section shall be maintained by the licensee throughout the term of the license, and such other
period of time during which the licensee is operating without a license hereunder, or is engaged in the removal of its facilities, as evidenced by one
or more current certificates of insurance which shall be kept on file with the village manager, or his or her designee. Each such insurance policy
shall contain the following endorsement:
It is hereby understood and agreed that this policy may not be canceled nor the intention not to renew be stated until thirty (30) days after receipt
by the Village, by registered mail of a written notice addressed to the Village Manager of such intent to cancel or not to renew.
f. Prior to cancellation of any of the aforesaid insurance policies, the licensee shall obtain and furnish to the village replacement insurance policies
meeting the requirements of this section and in such amount(s) and form acceptable to, and approved in advance in writing by, the village
manager, or his or her designee. The termination or expiration of insurance without replacement insurance as provided herein, shall automatically
terminate the licensee's license.
17. Indemnification:
a. Agreement For Indemnification Required: Each license agreement shall include, to the extent permitted by law, licensee's express undertaking to
defend, indemnify and hold the village and its officers, employees, agents and representatives harmless from and against challenges to the
licensee's license, and against any and all damages, losses and expenses, including reasonable attorney fees and costs of suit or defense, arising
out of, resulting from or alleged to arise out of or result from the negligent, careless or wrongful acts, omissions, failures to act or misconduct of the
licensee or its affiliates, officers, employees, agents, contractors or subcontractors in the construction, installation, operation, maintenance, repair
and/or removal of its facilities, whether such acts or omissions are authorized, allowed or prohibited by this section or by a separate grant
agreement made or entered into pursuant to this section.
b. Recording Of Agreement Required: The license agreement, including, but not limited to, the aforesaid indemnification provisions thereof, shall
constitute a covenant running with the land, shall be recorded in the office of the recorder of deeds for each county in which the licensed premises
are located, and shall be binding on the licensee and/or any heirs, successors, and assigns of the licensee. If the village records the license
agreement, the applicant shall reimburse the village for the cost of recording and any other out of pocket expenses incurred by the village for that
purpose.
18. Coordination Of Construction Activities; Responsibility For Restoration And Repairs: All licensees are required to cooperate with the village.
a. All construction locations, activities and schedules shall be coordinated, as ordered by the village manager, or his or her designee, to minimize
public inconvenience, disruption or damages.
b. Each licensee shall adjust to depth, line, and/or grade at its sole expense all of their facilities and all appurtenances related thereto in the public
way at the time of any rehabilitation, repair or reconstruction of any public way.
c. Each licensee shall be and remain obligated to fully restore, repair, and/or replace such licensee's facilities, at such licensee's sole expense, to the
extent that such facilities may be damaged, disturbed, and/or otherwise affected from time to time by any work performed and/or in any manner
authorized within such public way(s) by the village, and the village, and its officers, employees, agents, and contractors, shall have no such
obligation in that regard.
19. Transfer And Assignment: The licensee shall not have the right to assign its rights and privileges under this section or to otherwise transfer it in any
manner whatsoever without the prior written approval of the corporate authorities granted by ordinance or resolution. In the event of a transfer or
assignment of the licensee's rights and privileges under this section, all provisions of this section which are obligatory upon or which inure to the
benefit of the licensee shall also be obligatory upon and shall inure to the benefit of any and all successors and assigns of the licensee, including, but
not limited to, those licensee obligations with respect to insurance coverage as set forth in subsection C16 of this section and with respect to the
execution of a written indemnification agreement as set forth in subsection C17 of this section.
20. Transactions Affecting Control Of Licensee: Any transactions which singularly or collectively result in a change of ten percent (10%) or more of the
ownership or working control of the licensee, of the ownership or working control of a license, of the ownership or working control of affiliated entities
having ownership or working control of the licensee or of a licensee's facilities, of the capacity of such facilities, or any substantial portions thereof,
shall be considered an assignment or transfer requiring village approval pursuant to this section. Transactions between affiliated entities are not
exempt from such approval by the corporate authorities. The corporate authorities, at their sole discretion, shall approve or deny in writing, by
ordinance or resolution, any such transfer of ownership or control of a licensee, and denial of such transfer of ownership or control of a licensee by
the corporate authorities shall constitute an automatic termination of the respective right of way license previously granted by the corporate
authorities, and said licensee shall be required to immediately remove all of its facilities from any public way. Any such successors or assigns of any
licensee shall be fully obligated to timely comply with the requirements of this section, including, but not limited to, those licensee obligations with
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 282/522
respect to insurance coverage as set forth in subsection C16 of this section and with respect to the execution of a written indemnification agreement
as set forth in subsection C17 of this section, and timely compliance with such licensee obligations shall be conditions of the approval of any such
transfer or assignment. (Ord. 08-3442, 4-14-2008)
21. Digital Data Standards: All submittals to the village and/or to any engineer, architect, surveyor, or other consultant retained by the village as
required by this section shall comply with the village's digital data standards set forth in title 1, chapter 16, "Digital Data Standards", of this code.
(Ord. 09-3536, 8-17-2009)
7-1-7: SNOW AND ICE REMOVAL:
A. Duty To Remove:
1. Removal From Sidewalks: It shall be the duty of every owner, lessee, tenant, occupant or other person having charge of any premises located in the
village which abuts upon any public sidewalk to keep the sidewalk abutting such premises free from snow as hereinafter provided.
2. Time Limit For Removal:
a. Business And Manufacturing Districts: The person having charge of premises zoned as any one of the "business" or "manufacturing"
classifications by the zoning ordinance of the village shall remove the snow which accumulates between the hours of seven o'clock (7:00) A.M.
and six o'clock (6:00) P.M., within three (3) hours after the same has accumulated to a depth of two inches (2"), except on Sundays or legal
holidays. The snow which accumulates on Sundays or legal holidays or between the hours of six o'clock (6:00) P.M. and seven o'clock (7:00) A.M.
on any other day shall be removed by the succeeding ten o'clock (10:00) A.M. of any day, Monday through Saturday (except legal holidays) if it
accumulates to a depth of two inches (2").
b. Residential Districts: The person having charge of premises zoned as any one of the "residential" classifications by the zoning ordinance of the
village shall remove the snow which accumulates within twenty four (24) hours after the same has accumulated to a depth of two inches (2").
B. Deposits On Streets And Sidewalks Prohibited; Nuisance Declared:
1. No person, firm, or corporation or its agent who removes or causes to be removed any snow or ice from any building, private property, parking lot,
driveway, driveway apron, driveway approach, or public sidewalk shall sweep, blow, plow, shovel, scrape, drag or in any other manner move or
deposit snow or ice in such a way as to decrease the drivable width of any street or alley, block the vision of motorists at any intersection, prevent
parking at a curb, cover any fire hydrants or otherwise interfere with their use, block any public sidewalks or driveways, damage parkway trees, sod,
or curbing within a public right of way, or otherwise create any traffic hazard or destruction of property.
2. Any snow or ice deposited in violation of subsection B1 of this section is hereby declared to be a nuisance. The director of public works, or his
designee, may remove all snow and ice so deposited and the reasonable cost of such removal shall be charged to and payable by the violator. Any
person, firm or corporation or agent thereof who is alleged to have violated subsection B1 of this section shall be afforded an opportunity to provide
evidence that the said deposit of snow or ice occurred as a result of the acts of the owner or occupant of another property or the agent of the other
property owner, so long as the alleged violator submits a written request for a hearing to the director of public works not later than ten (10) days after
the alleged violator receives notice of the assessed costs of removal.
C. Interference With Snow Removal Operations Prohibited: It shall be unlawful for any person, firm, or corporation or agent thereof to obstruct, harass,
prevent, or otherwise interfere with any employee or contractor of the village who is engaged in snow removal service or to obstruct, cause damage to,
or otherwise interfere with any village owned or leased vehicle used in snow removal services. (Ord. 08-3442, 4-14-2008)
D. Penalty: Any person, firm or corporation or agent thereof who violates any of the provisions of this section (hereinafter "violator") shall be subject to the
penalty as specified from time to time in section 1-14-1 of this code. Each day that a violation is permitted to exist shall constitute a separate offense.
(Ord. 09-3495, 2-9-2009)
7-1-8: DEPOSITS ON PUBLIC WAYS:
A. Harmful Deposits Generally: It shall be unlawful to deposit on any street or sidewalk any material which may be harmful to the pavement thereof, or any
waste material, or any glass, or other article which may cause injury to any person, animal or property.
B. Streets: Materials may be deposited in streets preparatory to delivery for use; provided, that such deposit does not reduce the usable width of the street
or roadway at that point to less than eighteen feet (18'); and provided, that such material other than material used in actual building construction, shall
not be permitted to remain in such street for more than six (6) hours. Any such material shall be guarded by lighted barricades if the same remains
upon any streets during nighttime.
C. Sidewalks: Merchandise or other articles may be deposited on sidewalks preparatory to delivery; provided, that the usable width of the sidewalk is not
thereby reduced to less than four feet (4'); and provided, that no such article shall remain on such walk for more than one-half (1/2) hour. (Ord. 08-3442,
4-14-2008)
7-1-9: OBSTRUCTIONS AND ENCROACHMENTS:
A. Obstructions And Encroachments Generally:
1. Except as otherwise specifically provided by this code, it shall be unlawful for any person to cause, create or maintain any obstruction of, or
encroachment upon any public way(s), whether on, above or below ground level, except as may be specifically authorized by the corporate
authorities or by the village manager.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 283/522
2. Village sidewalks shall be kept free and clear of all obstacles, overhanging and otherwise (including vehicles), to allow pedestrians the full,
unobstructed utilization thereof, except as may be specifically authorized by the corporate authorities or by the village manager.
3. However, no obstruction or encroachment upon any street or highway under the jurisdiction of the state shall be permitted except as specifically
authorized by the state and the corporate authorities. The corporate authorities will cooperate in a reasonable manner with the state in disposing of
any existing encroachments within State Route 59 (F.A. Route 23) between Barrington Road and U.S. Route 14.
B. Obstructing Drains, Ditches, And Swales: It shall be unlawful to obstruct any drain, ditch, and/or swale in any public way(s).
C. Invisible Fence Prohibited: No person shall install or maintain any aboveground or underground invisible fence within any public way(s).
D. Permitted Exceptions: The private structure(s) and/or facilities as specified below may be permitted in a public way without a right of way use license as
otherwise required by this chapter, but only if authorized, installed, operated, maintained, in timely and continued compliance with this section and any
permit issued pursuant to this section for same. Except as otherwise provided in this code, all other private structures, facilities, and improvements
shall constitute obstruction(s) and encroachment(s) of the public way(s) and shall be prohibited in such public way(s).
1. Mailboxes: Mailboxes, and necessary mailbox support structures, may be erected and maintained in the parkway of any public way(s) adjacent to
the postal patron's property, subject, however, to the conditions set forth below:
a. No part of any mailbox or any mailbox support structure, or any appurtenance thereto, shall be located or maintained closer than eight inches (8")
from the back of the curb (or from the edge of pavement on streets without curbs), nor shall the front of any mailbox be located farther than twelve
inches (12") from the back of the curb (or from the edge of the pavement on streets without curbs).
b. Mailbox support structures shall be forty two inches (42") in height from the road pavement to the bottom of the mailbox.
c. Mailbox support structures shall be constructed of breakaway material, either four inch by four inch (4" x 4") or a USPS approved premanufactured
support.
d. No mailbox support structure shall be buried less than twenty four inches (24") into the ground.
e. Any other mailbox support structure is not acceptable. Unacceptable support structures include, but are not limited to, brick, block, stone or
concrete masonry columns, wagon wheels, lumber posts in excess of four inches by four inches (4" x 4"), and steel pipes, unless part of a USPS
approved premanufactured support. Mailbox support structures which do not conform with this section shall be replaced with conforming mailbox
structures within twelve (12) months of the village notifying the owner and/or occupant of the subject property of such nonconformance.
f. No right of way use license, permit, or fee shall be required for any mailbox and the related mailbox support structure if both the mailbox and the
mailbox support structure conform to the conditions of this subsection D.
2. Lawn Sprinkling Systems: No person shall install or maintain any aboveground or underground lawn sprinkling system within any public way(s)
without having secured a permit issued by the village manager, or his or her designee. Such aboveground or underground lawn sprinkling system
shall be subject to the following regulations:
a. It shall be the sole responsibility of the applicant(s) to maintain and repair the lawn sprinkling system and to relocate such system, if required by
the village. The applicant(s) shall indemnify and defend the village from any and all liability for damages or injury arising from the installation,
operation or location of the sprinkling system.
b. Each person who has installed or has caused to be installed any aboveground or underground lawn sprinkling system within any public way(s)
shall be and remain obligated to fully restore, repair, and/or replace such alternative paving to the extent that such facilities may be damaged,
disturbed, and/or otherwise affected from time to time by any work performed and/or in any manner authorized by the village, and the village shall
have no obligation to bear any costs relative to such restoration, repair and/or replacement.
(1) The lawn sprinkling system and heads shall not be placed closer than four feet (4') from the back of the curb or closer than four feet (4') from
the edge of the sidewalk and shall be so installed and operated as not to spray water onto the sidewalk, curb, gutter or street, or onto any other
public way. (Ord. 08-3451, 6-23-2008)
(2) The nonrefundable permit fee for a lawn sprinkling system located or to be located within any public way shall be as specified from time to time
in section 1-14-1 of this code and shall be paid to the village by the applicant at the time such application is submitted to the village, provided,
however, such fee shall be in addition to the permit fee applicable to any portion of the lawn sprinkling system that may be located on private
property. (Ord. 09-3495, 2-9-2009)
(3) If such a lawn sprinkling system is authorized, installed, operated, and maintained in timely and continued compliance with this section and the
terms and conditions of the permit issued pursuant to this section for same, then in such event, such lawn sprinkling system shall not require a
right of way use license as otherwise provided by this chapter.
3. Landscaping: No person shall install or maintain any landscaping other than grass, turf, or other ground cover and approved parkway trees within
any public way(s) without having secured a permit issued by the village manager, or his or her designee. Such landscaping shall be subject to the
following regulations:
a. The landscaping shall not be placed closer than four feet (4') from the back of the curb or closer than four feet (4') from the edge of the sidewalk
and shall be so installed and maintained as not to obstruct any sidewalk, curb, gutter or street.
b. If such landscaping is authorized, installed, and maintained in timely and continued compliance with this section and the terms and conditions of
the permit issued pursuant to this section, then in such event, such landscaping shall not require a right of way use license as otherwise provided
by this chapter.
4. Alternative Paving Treatment: No person, other than the village, shall install or maintain, or cause to be installed or maintained, any alternative
paving treatment in a public way without having secured a permit from the village. Such alternative paving treatment shall be subject to the following
regulations:
a. Permit: A permit issued by the village manager, or his or her designee, and a right of way use license as provided in subsection 7-1-6C of this
chapter shall be secured before a property owner may construct or install any form of alternative paving in any public way.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 284/522
b. Alternative Treatments: Alternative paving treatments include, without limitation, brick pavers, exposed aggregate or concrete, stamped or
embossed concrete, or any other pavement, except such pavement(s) as specified in subsection 7-3-4D of this title.
c. Locations: Alternative paving treatments in the right of way shall be limited to locations including driveway approaches, service walks, carriage
walks, and those areas on corner lots where two (2) streets meet at right angles.
d. Public Sidewalks: No alternative paving surface shall be constructed or installed on or over any public sidewalk.
e. Responsibility For Restoration And Repairs: Each person who has installed or has caused to be installed any alternative paving treatment within
any public way(s) shall be and remain obligated to fully restore, repair, replace, and/or relocate such alternative paving to the extent that such
facilities may be damaged, disturbed, and/or otherwise affected from time to time by any work performed and/or in any manner authorized by the
village, and the village shall have no obligation to bear any costs relative to such restoration, repair and/or replacement provided, however,
notwithstanding anything contained in this section to the contrary, the village may, but shall not be obligated to, when the corporate authorities or
the village manager, or his or her designee, in their sole discretion, deems it feasible to do so, either to restore, repair, and/or replace such
alternative paving treatment at its expense or to reimburse a party who is required to restore, repair, and/or replace alternative paving treatment
damaged, disturbed, and/or otherwise affected by work performed or authorized by the village, based upon a unit price being currently or relatively
recently utilized by the village for asphalt or concrete apron replacement work by a contractor.
f. Compliance With Chapter: If an alternative paving treatment is installed and maintained in timely and continued compliance with this chapter and
the terms and conditions of the permit issued for same pursuant to this section, then, in such case(s), such alternative paving treatment shall not
require a right of way use license as otherwise provided by this chapter.
5. Permit Requirements: The following requirements shall be applicable to all permits issued for improvement(s) and/or improvements permitted
pursuant to this section: (Ord. 08-3451, 6-23-2008)
a. Permit Application And Fee: The permit application shall include a copy of the plans and specifications for the improvement(s) proposed by the
applicant(s). The nonrefundable permit application fee for such improvement(s) shall be as specified from time to time in section 1-14-1 of this
code and shall be paid to the village by the applicant at the time such application is submitted to the village. (Ord. 09-3495, 2-9-2009)
b. Indemnification Agreement Required: The applicant(s) shall indemnify and defend the village from any and all liability for damages or injury arising
from the installation, location, and maintenance of such improvements. The permit application shall include an indemnification and waiver
agreement ("indemnification agreement") signed by the applicant(s), promising to hold harmless and defend the village or any of its agents,
officials, and employees from and against any property damage, personal injury or death that may result from granting the permit or from the
construction or installation of such improvement(s). The applicant(s) shall also waive and release any claim or action the applicant(s), and their
respective heirs, successors, and assigns may have against the village for damage to such improvement(s) resulting from village activities,
including, but not limited to, snow and ice removal on village rights of way and installation and/or maintenance of utilities located within the right of
way. The indemnification agreement shall be binding on the applicant(s) and on any heirs, successors, and assigns of the applicant(s).
c. Responsibility For Relocation, Restoration And Repairs: It shall be the responsibility of the applicant(s) and their heirs, successors and assigns
who have installed or have caused to be installed any improvement(s) within any public way(s) to fully restore, repair, replace, and/or relocate such
improvement(s) to the extent that such improvement(s) may be damaged, disturbed, and/or otherwise affected from time to time by any work
performed and/or in any manner authorized by the village, and the village shall have no obligation to bear any costs relative to such restoration,
repair replacement, and/or relocation provided, however, the village may, but shall not be obligated to, when the corporate authorities or the village
manager, or his or her designee, in their sole discretion, deems it feasible to do so, either to restore, repair, replace and/or relocate such
improvement(s) at its expense or to reimburse a party who is required to restore, repair, replace, and/or relocate such improvement(s) damaged,
disturbed, and/or otherwise affected by work performed or authorized by the village, based upon a current estimate obtained by the village for such
work by a qualified contractor. (Ord. 08-3451, 6-23-2008)
7-1-10: SCAFFOLDS, LADDERS AND TOOLS:
A. Safety Factors: Safety scaffolds or ladders placed in such position that they overhang or can fall onto any public way in the village shall be firmly and
properly constructed and safeguarded, and it shall be unlawful to place or leave any tool or article in any place in such a manner that the same could
fall into any such public way from a greater height than four feet (4').
B. Insurance Required: No person shall engage in any work which involves the maintenance of ladders, scaffolds or any other equipment on or
overhanging any such public way, or the use of any tools whatsoever on, over, or within any such public way, if a permit from the village is required for
such work, without filing a certificate of insurance as required for excavations by subsection 7-4-3A of this title. (Ord. 08-3442, 4-14-2008)
7-1-11: PROHIBITED ACTS AND CONDITIONS:
A. Injury To Pavements, Sidewalks, And Curbs: It shall be unlawful to in any way inscribe, walk upon or drive any vehicle or exercise any animal upon, or
in any way injure any newly laid street, curb, sidewalk, or alley pavement while the same is guarded by a warning sign or barricade, or to knowingly in
any way injure any street, sidewalk or alley pavement.
B. Throwing Missiles; Harmful Items: It shall be unlawful to cast, throw or propel any missile on or onto any public way, and it shall be unlawful to throw or
deposit any glass, nails, tacks or other similar articles on or onto any public way in the village.
C. Littering: It shall be unlawful to store or throw any refuse of any kind onto any public way.
D. Burning Refuse: It shall be unlawful for any person to burn any leaves, paper, rubbish or other substances upon any public way in the village.
E. Surface And Wastewater Discharges: It shall be unlawful to construct or permit the construction of any stormwater drain or air conditioner drain which
discharges water onto any public way in the village, and it shall be unlawful to construct or permit the maintenance of any such drain which discharges
into any public way.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 285/522
F. Drains; Swales: It shall be unlawful to obstruct any drain or swale in any public way.
G. Disturbing Safety Devices: It shall be unlawful to disturb or to interfere with any barricades, cones, or lights lawfully placed to protect or mark any new
pavement or excavation or opening in any public way. (Ord. 08-3442, 4-14-2008)
7-1-12: MAINTENANCE OF UNIMPROVED PORTIONS OF VILLAGE PUBLIC WAYS AND EASEMENTS:
A. Unless otherwise directed by the corporate authorities of the village, or by the village manager or his or her designee, the owner(s) and occupant(s) of
the abutting private or public property shall be jointly and severally obligated to and shall maintain the unimproved portions of any adjacent village
public way(s) to the centerline thereof, including, but not limited to, those unimproved areas commonly referred to as parkways, treebanks, and/or
shoulders, as well as any storm drains, culverts, ditches, swales, and all other drainage facilities and improvements located in such portions of village
public way(s), with the exception of any trees within such village public way(s) and with the exception of any public storm sewer(s) within such village
public way(s) which have been accepted for maintenance by the village. Such unimproved portions of village public way(s) shall be maintained by such
owner(s) and occupant(s) of the adjacent property free from obstructions except as authorized by this code, and in compliance with all applicable
standards and provisions of this code.
B. Unless otherwise directed by the corporate authorities of the village, or by the village manager or his or her designee, or unless otherwise provided by
the written terms of an easement(s) or other binding document, the owner(s) and occupant(s) of the private or public property(ies) upon which said
easement is located shall be jointly and severally obligated to and shall maintain the unimproved portions of any village easements on, upon, across,
and/or through their respective property(ies), including, but not limited to, any storm drains, culverts, ditches, swales, and all other drainage facilities
and improvements located in such unimproved portions of any such village easements, with the exception of public storm sewers which have been
accepted for maintenance by the village. Such unimproved portions of village easements shall be maintained by such owner(s) and occupant(s) free
from obstructions except as authorized by the village and/or the terms of such easement, and in compliance with all applicable standards and
provisions of this code.
C. For the purposes of this section, the term "unimproved" shall mean those areas not improved with pavement or gravel. For the purposes of this section,
the terms "maintenance" or "to maintain" shall include, but shall not be limited to, mowing any grass, cutting and removing any weeds, and keeping
drainage unimpeded, all as required by this code. (Ord. 08-3451, 6-23-2008)
Chapter 2
STREET AND SIDEWALK CONSTRUCTION
7-2-1: SUPERVISION:
Repair work on pavements and new construction, whether done by the village or the abutting owner, shall be under the supervision of the director of public
works. (1973 Code § 20-38)
7-2-2: PERMIT REQUIREMENTS:
A. Permit Required: It shall be unlawful to construct or lay any pavement on any public street, sidewalk, alley or other public way, or to repair the same,
without having first secured a permit therefor. (1973 Code § 20-32)
B. Application For Permit: Applications for permits required by this chapter shall be made to the director of public works and shall state the location of the
intended pavement or repair, the extent thereof, and the person or firm who is to do the actual construction work. (1973 Code § 20-33)
C. Insurance Required: Each applicant for a permit required by this chapter shall file a certificate of insurance covering commercial general liability
insurance in the amount of one million dollars ($1,000,000.00) combined single limit per occurrence for bodily injury and property damage, naming the
village as additional insured to hold the village harmless from any damages and cost which might be caused by accidents. (1973 Code § 20-35; amd.
2003 Code)
D. Issuance Of Permit: No permit required by this chapter shall be issued except on order of the director of development services. (Ord. 15-3837, 6-8-
2015)
7-2-3: CONSTRUCTION REQUIREMENTS:
A. Specifications: All street and sidewalk pavement construction and the grades and repairs thereof shall conform to the standards specified in the
subdivision regulations of the village, ordinance 675-1, and amendments thereto1. (1973 Code §§ 20-36, 20-37; amd. 2003 Code)
B. Roadway Width: Width of roadways shall conform to the standards set forth in the subdivision regulations of the village, ordinance 675-1, and
amendments thereto2. (1973 Code § 20-40)
C. Curbs And Gutters: Curbs and gutters shall conform to the standards set forth in the subdivision regulations of the village, ordinance 675-1, and
amendments thereto3. (1973 Code § 20-41)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 286/522
7-2-4: BARRICADES AND LIGHTS:
Any person laying or repairing any pavement on a street, sidewalk or other public place shall maintain suitable barricades to prevent injury of any person
or vehicle by reason of the work. Such barricades shall be protected by suitable lights at nighttime. (1973 Code § 20-39)
7-2-5: SURFACE WATER DRAINAGE:
Drainage structures shall be provided to dispose of stormwater runoff from paved surfaces. Said structures shall be properly connected to the existing or
proposed storm sewers. (1973 Code § 20-42)
Chapter 3
DRIVEWAYS
7-3-1: DEFINITIONS:
Whenever in this chapter the following terms are used, they shall have, for the purposes of this chapter, the meanings respectively ascribed to them in this
section:
DRIVEWAY APRON: A place improved for vehicular traffic on street right of way which connects the traveled portion of the street with the lot or parcel of
land adjacent thereto.
DRIVEWAY APRON, NONRESIDENTIAL: A driveway apron serving property used in whole or in part for other than residence purposes.
DRIVEWAY APRON, RESIDENTIAL: A driveway apron serving property used exclusively for residence purposes.
SIDEWALK: That portion of the street right of way between the curb lines or the lateral lines of a roadway and the adjacent property lines, intended for the
use of pedestrians. (1973 Code § 20-56)
7-3-2: PERMIT AND COMPLIANCE REQUIRED:
No person shall construct, build, establish or alter any driveway apron over, across, or upon any public sidewalk or parkway without first obtaining a permit
to do so from the building official. Such permit shall not be issued unless the application for permit complies with the requirements of this code and after
the fee and cash bond have been paid. (Ord. 03-3050, 1-13-2003)
7-3-3: RESIDENTIAL DRIVEWAYS:
A. Application For Permit: Any person desiring to construct, build, establish or alter a residential driveway or residential driveway apron in the village shall
make application to the building official for a permit. Such application shall be on the form provided by the village, and shall be accompanied by five (5)
sets of construction documents and/or a statement that the driveway and driveway apron will be installed or altered pursuant to the requirements of this
code.
B. Fees And Deposits:
1. Fees And Deposits Established:
a. After approval of the application, a residential driveway apron permit shall be issued upon the payment to the village treasurer of the
nonrefundable fees as specified from time to time in section 1-14-1 of this code.
b. In addition, any person submitting an application for a residential driveway or residential driveway apron permit which includes construction within
the public right of way shall deposit with the village treasurer prior to the issuance of a permit the fees as specified from time to time in section 1-
14-1 of this code which shall be refunded to the applicant if the building official finds that the work has been completed in conformance with this
code, without said applicant, his or her contractors, subcontractors or material suppliers having caused damage to the public right of way;
otherwise said deposit shall be forfeited to the village of Barrington, without prejudice to any other remedies of the village and the rights of the
village to pursue its remedies against the persons responsible for any such damage to the public right of way.
c. In addition, if a curb is to be removed, the applicant shall deposit with the village treasurer, prior to the issuance of a permit, an amount equal to
the fees as specified from time to time in section 1-14-1 of this code for each linear foot and each fraction thereof of curb to be removed, which
shall be refunded to the applicant if the building official finds that the work has been completed in conformance with this code, without said
applicant, his or her contractors, subcontractors or material suppliers having caused damage to the public right of way; otherwise said deposit shall
be forfeited to the village of Barrington, without prejudice to any other remedies of the village and the rights of the village to pursue its remedies
against the persons responsible for any such damage to the public right of way.
2. Forfeiture Of Deposits: Failure of the permittee or persons acting in consort or combination with him or her to comply with the specifications of this
section or any other applicable provisions of the village of Barrington ordinances, shall result in the forfeiture of any such deposits held by the village;
provided, however, that prior to any such forfeiture, the village shall give thirty (30) days' written notice to the applicant by U.S. mail, postage prepaid,
to the last address shown on the permit application in question that such action is contemplated and that he or she has the right to request a hearing
before the village manager on the question of such forfeiture within that time period, and that if the applicant fails to do so, said deposit shall be
automatically forfeited. If any such deposit is unclaimed for two (2) years, the same may be forfeited to the village by resolution adopted by the
village board, provided, however, that prior to the passage of such a resolution, the applicant shall be given thirty (30) days' written notice by U.S.
mail, postage prepaid, at the last address shown on the permit application in question, that such forfeiture is contemplated if the applicant fails to
claim the funds in question within the time period.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 287/522
C. Driveway Requirements:
1. Width: Driveway width shall not exceed twenty feet (20'), and driveway apron width measured at any point on the property line shall not exceed
twenty feet (20').
2. Flared Aprons: Driveway aprons may be flared out at the street except where a driveway apron crosses a curb line sidewalk. The maximum flare on
each side shall be two feet (2'), as parkway widths permit.
3. Materials Of Construction: The following standards shall be utilized for any driveway apron unless a permit has been secured in advance for
alternative paving treatment pursuant to subsection 7-1-9D4 of this title, and then only if all the requirements of subsection 7-1-9D4 of this title are
complied with:
a. The portion of the driveway apron which coincides with the public sidewalk shall be of Portland cement concrete, six (6) bag mix, air entrained,
with a minimum thickness of five inches (5").
b. Driveway aprons connecting to street pavements shall be constructed of either six inches (6") of rock base with two inch (2") bituminous surface,
or a six inch (6") thickness of Portland cement concrete, with 10-gauge six inch by six inch (6" x 6") wire mesh.
4. Curbs And Gutters: Where it is necessary to remove a curb, the curb and gutter shall be removed and replaced in kind, and shall be pinned with a
minimum three-fourths inch (3/4") epoxy coated rebar drilled into the existing curbs, in both the back of the curb as well as the gutter. Where the curb
is to be removed for the installation of a new driveway or sidewalk, the curb shall be removed and a new depressed curb shall be installed. The new
curb shall be pinned with a minimum three-fourths inch (3/4") epoxy coated rebar drilled into the existing curbs. Saw cutting the face of a curb for the
purpose of removing the back of the curb to create a depressed curb is prohibited; existing barrier curbs or mountable curbs shall be removed and
replaced with new depressed curb. All curbs shall meet the thickness of the existing curbs and shall be six (6) bag mix, air entrained. The cost of the
removal of the old curb and gutter and the installation of the new curb and gutter shall be borne by the applicant. (Ord. 09-3495, 2-9-2009)
D. Digital Data Standards: All submittals to the village and/or to any engineer, architect, surveyor, or other consultant retained by the village as required by
this section shall comply with the village's digital data standards set forth in title 1, chapter 16, "Digital Data Standards", of this code. (Ord. 09-3536, 8-
17-2009)
7-3-4: NONRESIDENTIAL DRIVEWAYS:
A. Application For Permit: Any person desiring to construct, build, establish or alter a nonresidential driveway or nonresidential driveway apron in the
village shall make application to the building official for a permit. Such application shall be on the form provided by the village, and shall be
accompanied by five (5) sets of construction documents which shall state whether or not it will be necessary to remove or otherwise alter a street or
curb or to elevate or depress the existing grade of the public walk or parkway, and shall state or specify that the driveway and driveway apron will be
installed or altered pursuant to the requirements of this code.
B. Construction Documents: No permit shall be issued for the construction or alteration of nonresidential driveway aprons until construction documents
therefor have been reviewed and approved by the building official. Such construction documents shall include driveway apron width, pavement
structure, any curbs and gutters to be removed and replaced, and the width and location of any public streets within one hundred fifty feet (150') of the
proposed driveway apron.
C. Fees And Deposits:
1. Fees And Deposits Established:
a. After approval of the application, a nonresidential driveway apron permit shall be issued upon the payment to the village treasurer of the
nonrefundable fees as specified from time to time in section 1-14-1 of this code.
b. In addition, any person submitting an application for a nonresidential driveway or nonresidential driveway apron permit which includes construction
within the public right of way shall deposit with the village treasurer prior to the issuance of a permit the fees as specified from time to time in
section 1-14-1 of this code which shall be refunded to the applicant if the building official finds that the work has been completed in conformance
with this code, without said applicant, his or her contractors, subcontractors or material suppliers having caused damage to the public right of way;
otherwise said deposit shall be forfeited to the village of Barrington, without prejudice to any other remedies of the village and the rights of the
village to pursue its remedies against the persons responsible for any such damage to the public right of way.
c. In addition, if a curb is to be removed, the applicant shall deposit with the village treasurer, prior to the issuance of a permit, an amount equal to
the fees as specified from time to time in section 1-14-1 of this code for each linear foot and each fraction thereof of curb to be removed, which
shall be refunded to the applicant if the building official finds that the work has been completed in conformance with this code, without said
applicant, his or her contractors, subcontractors or material suppliers having caused damage to the public right of way; otherwise said deposit shall
be forfeited to the village of Barrington, without prejudice to any other remedies of the village and the rights of the village to pursue its remedies
against the persons responsible for any such damage to the public right of way.
2. Forfeiture Of Deposits: Failure of the permittee or persons acting in consort or combination with him or her to comply with the specifications of this
section or any other applicable provisions of the village of Barrington ordinances, shall result in the forfeiture of any such deposits held by the village,
provided, however, that prior to any such forfeiture, the village shall give thirty (30) days' written notice to the applicant by U.S. mail, postage prepaid,
to the last address shown on the permit application in question that such action is contemplated, and that he or she has the right to request a hearing
before the village manager on the question of such forfeiture within that time period, and that if the applicant fails to do so, said deposit shall be
automatically forfeited. If any such deposit is unclaimed for two (2) years, the same may be forfeited to the village by resolution adopted by the
village board, provided, however, that prior to the passage of such a resolution, the applicant shall be given thirty (30) days' written notice by U.S.
mail, postage prepaid, at the last address shown on the permit application in question, that such forfeiture is contemplated if the applicant fails to
claim the funds in question within the time period.
D. Driveway Requirements: Nonresidential driveway aprons shall conform to the following:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 288/522
1. Width: Driveway apron widths measured at any point on the property line shall not exceed twenty four feet (24'); except, that driveway aprons
designed for one-way operation to or from parking areas shall not exceed fifteen feet (15') in width at the property line.
2. Flared Aprons: Driveway aprons may be flared out at the street except where a driveway apron crosses a curb line sidewalk. The maximum flare on
each side shall be four feet (4'), as parkway widths permit.
3. More Than One Driveway Per Lot: Where two (2) or more driveway aprons are to serve a single parcel of land, there shall be a separation between
the driveway aprons of at least twenty feet (20') measured along the curb and gutter line or edge of the pavement of the street.
4. Number Of Driveways: There may be no more than one two-way driveway apron, or two (2) one-way driveway aprons for each one hundred feet
(100'), or any fraction thereof, of frontage along right of way lines per parcel.
5. Construction Specifications: The following standards shall be utilized for any driveway apron unless a permit has been secured in advance for
alternative paving treatment pursuant to subsection 7-1-9D4 of this title, and then only if all the requirements of subsection 7-1-9D4 of this title are
complied with:
a. The driveway apron shall be of Portland cement concrete of a minimum thickness of six inches (6") with 10-gauge six inch by six inch (6" x 6") wire
mesh.
b. Where it adjoins the curb and gutter line, the driveway apron shall be faced with a depressed curb and gutter, said curb to include a raised vertical
lip of not less than one and five-eighths inches (15/8"), which shall be rounded off in finishing.
c. The driveway apron may also be constructed of six inches (6") of bituminous aggregate mix and surfaced with two inches (2") of class I bituminous
concrete surface course.
d. The portion of the driveway apron which coincides with the public sidewalk shall be of reinforced cement concrete, six (6) bag mix, air entrained,
with a minimum thickness of six inches (6"). (Ord. 09-3495, 2-9-2009)
E. Digital Data Standards: All submittals to the village and/or to any engineer, architect, surveyor, or other consultant retained by the village as required by
this section shall comply with the village's digital data standards set forth in title 1, chapter 16, "Digital Data Standards", of this code. (Ord. 09-3536, 8-
17-2009)
7-3-5: CULVERTS:
A. Culverts Required: No person shall install or maintain any driveway apron anywhere in the village without installing, under the driveway apron, a culvert
of adequate size to permit complete stormwater drainage. No culvert shall be required where a concrete or other hard surface curb and gutter in the
street provides adequate stormwater drainage.
B. Specifications:
1. The village manager shall determine the diameter of culvert, if any, required to provide adequate drainage.
2. Each culvert shall not be less than twenty feet (20') in length and ten inches (10") in diameter, and constructed of galvanized steel or of such other
material of equivalent strength and resistance to corrosion as approved by the village manager.
3. At each end of the culvert, a flared end section, of the same material as the culvert, shall be installed. (1973 Code § 20-65)
C. Deposit Required: The person required to install such culvert shall, prior to issuance of a building permit and prior to commencing any construction on
the culvert or driveway apron, deposit with the village treasurer the fees as specified from time to time in section 1-14-1 of this code, at the time a
building permit is obtained. Such deposited money shall be refunded to the applicant upon the satisfactory installation of the culvert and its approval by
the village manager. If such culvert is not installed by the property owner within six (6) months after issuance of a building permit, then the village may
install such culvert and the sum deposited therefor shall become the property of the village, unless the applicant, within said six (6) months, returns the
permit to the village manager for cancellation, and the village manager, after inspection, determines that no work has been done on said driveway
apron within the right of way of any street, and no culvert is otherwise required. (Ord. 09-3495, 2-9-2009)
D. Curb And Gutter: Where a curb has to be removed, the curb and gutter must be removed and a depressed curb and gutter put back in its place. The
work shall be done in conformance with current village requirements and specifications and shall be approved by the village manager. The cost of the
removal of the old curb and construction of the depressed curb and gutter shall be paid by the applicant. (1973 Code § 20-65)
7-3-6: DRIVEWAY SURFACES:
No driveway apron shall be so constructed or graded as to leave a step, sharp depression or other obstruction on the sidewalk. The grade shall be as
nearly as possible the same as that of the adjoining sidewalk. It shall be unlawful to have the surface finish of any driveway apron where the same crosses
the sidewalk constructed of such materials as to render it slippery or hazardous to pedestrians, or to have the grade of such portion vary from the grade of
the sidewalk, or be other than level. (1973 Code § 20-69)
7-3-7: MAINTENANCE REQUIREMENTS:
A. It shall be the duty of the person maintaining any driveway apron to keep the same free from snow and ice or any obstruction, and to keep the same in
good repair where the same crosses a public walk. (1973 Code § 20-68)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 289/522
B. It shall be necessary for the owner or occupant of adjacent property to keep the gutter abutting a private driveway apron free from foreign material or
objects. (1973 Code § 20-67)
7-3-8: PROHIBITED ACTS AND CONDITIONS:
A. Obstructing, Altering Gutter Or Drainage Ditch: It shall be unlawful for any person to alter or obstruct established or prescribed gutters or drainage
ditches. (1973 Code § 20-66)
B. Use For Parking: It shall be unlawful to use any driveway apron for parking areas. (1973 Code § 20-70)
Chapter 4
EXCAVATIONS AND TUNNELS
7-4-1: SUPERVISION:
All excavations, refills and resurfacing shall be made subject to the supervision and under the direction of the director of public works or designee. (1973
Code § 20-85; amd. 2003 Code)
7-4-2: PERMIT REQUIREMENTS:
A. Permit Required: It shall be unlawful to make any excavation in or tunnel under any public street, alley, sidewalk, or other public place in the village
without having first secured a permit therefor. (1973 Code § 20-82)
B. Application For Permit: Applications for permits required by this chapter shall be made to the code official and shall specify the intended location and
purpose of the excavation. (1973 Code § 20-83; amd. 2003 Code)
7-4-3: INSURANCE AND DEPOSIT REQUIRED:
A. Insurance: No permit shall be issued for making any excavation or tunnel in, on or under any public street, parkway, sidewalk or alley unless there shall
be filed with the village clerk a certificate of insurance covering commercial general liability insurance in the amount of one million dollars
($1,000,000.00) combined single limit per occurrence for bodily injury and property damage, naming the village as additional insured to hold the village
harmless from any damages and cost which might be caused by accidents. (1973 Code § 20-86; amd. 2003 Code)
B. Deposit Required: No permit required by this chapter shall be issued unless the applicant has also filed with the village clerk a cash deposit in an
amount as specified from time to time in section 1-14-1 of this code, and said applicant shall file a larger deposit as the director of public works or
designee determines necessary to ensure that the surface of such public place shall be restored to its original condition upon completion of the work. If,
within three (3) months of the commencement of the work, the surface is so properly restored, the amount of the deposit shall be returned to the
applicant or his assignee. If it is not restored within this time, the money shall become the property of the village unless the applicant, within said three
(3) months, returns the permit to the village manager for cancellation and the village manager, after inspection, determines that no work has been done
at such public place. If work has been done on the public place but it has not been restored, the village may, but shall not be obligated to, restore the
surface using the deposit to pay the cost thereof. (Ord. 09-3495, 2-9-2009)
7-4-4: BARRICADES AND LIGHTS:
Any person making an excavation in any pavement on a street, sidewalk or other public place, shall maintain suitable barricades to prevent injury of any
person or vehicle by reason of the work. Such barricades shall be protected by suitable lights at nighttime. (1973 Code § 20-88)
7-4-5: RESTORATION OF EXCAVATED AREA:
Any person making any excavation shall refill the same properly and shall restore the surface to its condition before the excavation was made, as soon as
possible. (1973 Code § 20-84)
Chapter 5
VILLAGE PROPERTY USE REGULATIONS
7-5-1: HOURS OF OPERATION:
All property owned by the Village, other than public highways, streets and alleys, and parking areas and buildings, shall be open daily to the public during
the hours between sunrise and ten o'clock (10:00) P.M. It shall be unlawful for person or persons, other than authorized personnel conducting official
business, to occupy or be present on said property during any hours which any Village property is not open to the public. Any section or part of any Village
property may be declared closed to the public by an officer or employee of the Village at any time, and for any interval of time, either temporarily, or at a
regularly stated time. (1973 Code § 15-110)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=576 290/522
7-5-2: SMOKING AND/OR VAPING IN VILLAGE BUILDINGS PROHIBITED1:
It shall be unlawful for any person to smoke or to carry any form of lighted tobacco product(s) or to vape or otherwise use any alternative nicotine
product(s) in any building on Village property. Notice of this prohibition shall be given by appropriate signs visible to persons entering such buildings. For
the purposes of this section, to "smoke", or "smoking" shall be and/or include the act of inhaling the smoke from or possessing a lighted tobacco product(s)
or similar substance used for smoking, or the act of inhaling, ingesting, vaporizing, vaping or otherwise using alternative nicotine products, smoking herbs,
